FuncDef:
The tcp ipv6 window command sets a TCP6 window size for setting up a TCP6 connection.
The undo tcp ipv6 window command restores the default TCP6 window size. The tcp ipv6 window command sets a TCP6 window size for setting up a TCP6 connection. The undo tcp ipv6 window command restores the default TCP6 window size. By default, the TCP6 window size is 8 Kbytes. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a TCP6 window size, in Kbytes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32, in KBytes.

ExtraInfo: To change the TCP6 window size that is used for setting up a TCP session, run the tcp window command.
